data.question: What is the empirical formula of compound 1?
At what temperature was compound 1 synthesized?
What change in synthesis conditions leads to the formation of compound 2 instead of compound 1?
Is the structure of compound 1 interpenetrated?
Does increasing the concentration of starting materials favor the formation of compound 2 over compound 1?
What is the crystal system of compound 1?
What is the effect of temperature on the interpenetration of the compounds?
Is the IR spectrum of compound 1 identical to that of compound 2?
What is the role of 4,4′-bipyridine in the synthesis of compounds 1 and 2?
data.answer: It acts as a pillar in the framework

data.question: Does compound 1 exhibit a higher free volume compared to compound 2?
What is the coordination geometry around the Cd2+ ions in compound 1?
What is the effect of concentration on the synthesis of compounds 1 and 2?
data.answer: Higher concentrations tend to favor the formation of compound 2

data.question: Are the pyridyl rings of the bipy pillar in compound 2 twisted compared to those in compound 1?
What is the significance of the 'concentration effect' in the synthesis of metal-organic materials?
data.answer: It influences the possibility of forming a sublattice in the voids of noninterpenetrated structures

data.question: Is the thermal stability of a highly interpenetrated structure higher than that of a noninterpenetrated structure?
What is the role of temperature in controlling interpenetration according to the study?
data.answer: It influences the thermodynamic stability and density of the crystal forms

data.question: Can the observations regarding temperature and concentration control over interpenetration be considered a general rule for all metal-organic materials?
What is the calculated free volume percentage of the unit cell in compound 1?
Does the study provide a method to control the synthesis of metal-organic materials?
What is the impact of interpenetration on the properties of metal-organic materials?
data.answer: It affects thermal stability, molecular recognition, and free volume
